articles.author: By KIM CHANDLER Associated Press
articles.title: Attorneys: Alabama making little progress in prison staffing
articles.description: MONTGOMERY, Ala. (AP) — Alabama has made little progress in meeting a court order to dramatically increase the number of corrections officers working in state prisons, attorneys for state inmates told a federal judge Friday.
articles.content:
MONTGOMERY, Ala. (AP) Alabama has made little progress in meeting a court order to dramatically increase the number of corrections officers working in state prisons, attorneys for state inmates told a federal judge Friday.

articles.title: Rhode Island requests new federal review of truck toll suit
articles.description: PROVIDENCE, R.I. (AP) — Attorneys for the state are asking a federal court to let a challenge to the Rhode Island's truck toll program be decided in state court.
articles.content:
PROVIDENCE, R.I. (AP) Attorneys for the state are asking a federal court to let a challenge to the Rhode Island's truck toll program be decided in state court.

articles.author: By TOM CANAVAN AP Sports Writer
articles.title: New York Giants interview former Packers coach Mike McCarthy
articles.description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. (AP) — Mike McCarthy, who won a Super Bowl with the Green Bay Packers and led them to nine playoff appearances in 13 seasons, has interviewed for the head coaching job with the New York Giants.
articles.content:
EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. (AP) Mike McCarthy, who won a Super Bowl with the Green Bay Packers and led them to nine playoff appearances in 13 seasons, has interviewed for the head coaching job with the New York Giants.

articles.author: By MICHAEL RUBINKAM Associated Press
articles.title: Pipeline company fined $30M but can resume construction
articles.description: Pennsylvania fined an energy company more than $30 million on Friday but will allow it to resume construction on its problem-plagued natural gas pipelines.
articles.content:
Pennsylvania fined an energy company more than $30 million on Friday but will allow it to resume construction on its problem-plagued natural gas pipelines.

articles.title: Police: Man's DNA linked to sexual assaults in Arizona, Utah
articles.description: FLAGSTAFF, Ariz. (AP) — A man accused of sexual assaults in Arizona and Utah more than 15 years ago has been arrested after DNA analysis pointed investigators to his relatives, authorities said Friday.
